I am proud that the House passed this vital legislation to support the right of the Hong Kong people to protest abuses and stand up for freedom.

I introduced a resolution with Congressman Brad Sherman to recognize Hong Kong’s bilateral relationship with the United States and condemn China for violently disregarding its obligations to the people of Hong Kong.

Our support for our friends in Hong Kong remains strong. While their fundamental right to protest is under attack and government-sanctioned brutalities continue to be reported, we stand with them in their fight for democracy.

The St. Louis Zoo is a local treasure that brings joy to our community and their local and international conservation efforts do not go unnoticed. pic.twitter.com/lTZSzTty3K
Thanks to the work of the Ron Goellner Center for Hellbender Conservation, the St. Louis Zoo, and the MDC, the hellbender population has increased every year since 2011.

Missouri is the home of the only two subspecies of the hellbender salamander, also known as the giant salamander. These amphibians have suffered a serious decline in numbers over the past three decades, making the hellbender the only endangered amphibian in Missouri.

I recently met with staff of the @stlzoo and learned about Missouri's amphibian populations. The Zoo's WildCare Institute has partnered with the Missouri Department of Conservation (MDC) to help implement conservation action for the hellbender salamander.
